name: rebalance
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to make things equal again, so that no part has too much importance, weight, or force: It is important to re-balance the relationship between the capital city and the provinces. The practitioner's hands rest lightly on various parts of your body, rebalancing your energy.
More examplesFewer examplesThe exercises will build strength and rebalance your muscles.Tourism could play a part in re-balancing the economy while the value of the pound is low.The herbs are said to rebalance hormones and increase mental efficiency.

to change the amount or level of one or more things in order to improve a particular situation: The currency is too strong and needs to fall to help rebalance the economy. We used the profits to rebalance our portfolio with about 55% US stocks, 20% foreign, and 25% bonds and cash.
